column3:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #20976 (doc: fix broken link to whitepaper in README by ben-kaufman)

If you consider this pull request important, pleas

ACK 77772a1b809e443a6861ee49009ff8bc55cff9c3

> Remove dead? link to translation mailing list. Reason: The translation process is explained in doc/translation_process.md, no need to explain it in detail in the main readme.

Good find. I can't even remember anymore when we used that list.

isn't that a bit flimsy? It's not so hard to game Google rankings (and you can always buy ads, too), so googling "original Bitcoin whitepaper" could really give you anything. At least a footnote or something with bibliographic information (such as it is) would be nice, or maybe a md5sum of the "real" whitepaper, if that is feasible

Crazy idea: what about adding instructions (or a script) on how to fetch the whitepaper directly from the UTXO set, as described e.g. by jb55 in https://bitcoinhackers.org/@jb55/105595146491662406 ("eat your own dogfood" ;-))

> or maybe a md5sum of the "real" whitepaper, if that is feasible

Inb4 content-addressed storage (e.g. IPFS).

In any case, something like that could be added later, let's remove the broken link.

Maybe there could be an extensive stack exchange question or documentation file that explains where and how to get the whitepaper and how to check it against a hashsum? If needed we could link to that. Though, I think this can be done in a follow-up. And if your search engine was bought to redirect the traffic, you might not find this repo in the first place ;)

Apparently it is actually on IPFS. [gateway link here](https://gateway.ipfs.io/ipfs/QmRA3NWM82ZGynMbYzAgYTSXCVM14Wx1RZ8fKP42G6gjgj)\nUsers of [some browsers](https://github.com/ipfs/in-web-browsers) like Brave can use the IPFS link directly and don't  need the gateway.
Would this suffice as the Stack Exchange question to link to? https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/35959/how-is-the-whitepaper-decoded-from-the-blockchain-tx-with-1000x-m-of-n-multisi

@michaelfolkson sort of ! unfortunately it uses the blocktrail API instead of bitcoin core RPC, i prefer that if we send people on a puzzle to get it, they'd at least learn to use our APIs along the way  :smile: \n\n(maybe a matter of adding an answer, though)

There's a comment on how to do it with a pruned node, using the RPC: https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com/questions/35959/how-is-the-whitepaper-decoded-from-the-blockchain-tx-with-1000x-m-of-n-multisi#comment115247_101707
